intro: Eustegia plicata, commonly known as the pleated bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, pleated, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Eustegia plicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
